blog.name: reverend61
blog.title: The reverend61 tumblr digest
blog.description: I have several blogs. They are: Brian of Morbius, my Doctor Who blog Glurgewatch, a collection of all the dross the web has to offer, and Stuff I Had To Put Somewhere - anything else that doesn't fit the above. The tumblr page is a nice way of putting it all together...

summary: Have I Got Whos For You (Easter special)
title: Have I Got Whos For You (Easter special)
body:
Have I Got Whos For You (Easter special)

I’m going to be poking a sizeable portion of the fandom with a stick in a few days, folks, so do tune in later this week if you want to see the fireworks. I should point out that there’s nothing sensationalist about it; I just felt like a bit of a rant. You know, like when you’re in a Subway and they’ve stopped heating the sandwiches even though it’s only half past eight and they’re not closing…

View On WordPress

tags: david tennant does a podcast with
summary: Okay but that podcast was the best thing ever. Just listening to Michael talk for an hour about things he is so passionate...
body:
Okay but that podcast was the best thing ever. Just listening to Michael talk for an hour about things he is so passionate about. Davis is honestly a fantastic host.

I’m more and more in love with both of them. Excuse me while I go cry.

blog.name: fuckyeahgoodomens
blog.title: Fuck Yeah Good Omens
blog.description: Funniest apocalypse ever!

summary: David Tennant’s podcast with Michael Sheen
title: David Tennant’s podcast with Michael Sheen
body:
Michael Sheen: Eventually he [Neil Gaiman] sent me one of the scripts, an early draft for like the first episode of Good Omens, and we started talking about me being involved and doing it - he said ‘Would you be interested?’ and I said ‘Yeah, of course, oh my god!’ and he said ‘Well, I’ll send you the scripts when they come…’ and I would read them and we’d talk about them a little bit - so I was sort of involved. 

But it was always at that point, ‘cause he’d always said about playing Crowley in it. And as time went on, as I was reading the scripts, I was thinking: I don’t think I can play Crowley, I don’t think I’m goint to be able to do it. And I’d start to get a bit nervous ‘cause I don’t want to tell Neil that I don’t think I can do this but I just felt I don’t think I can play Crowley. 

David Tennant: Of course you could. 

Michael Sheen: Just, on a sort of gut level - you now sometimes on a gut level you feel ‘I can do this or I can’t do this’. And I just thought: You know what, this is just not the part for me, the other part is better for me, I think. I think I can do that, I don’t think I can do that. But I was scared to tell Neil, ‘cause I thought: Well he wants me to play Crowley. And it turned out he had been feeling the same way, and he hadn’t wanted to mention it to me but he was like ‘I think Michael should really play Aziraphale’. And neither of us would bring it up, and then eventually we did and it was one of those things where you go, ‘Oh thank God you said that, I feel exactly the same way!’ 

And then I think that within a fairly short space of time, he said, ‘I think we’ve got David Tennant for Crowley’. And we both got very excited about that, and then all these extraordinary people started joining in.

…

Michael Sheen: This is the only thing I’ve done where I really don’t think of it as ‘my character’ or ‘my performance’, I think of it totallly as ‘us’, ‘the two of us’. What I do is defined by what you do.

You can listen to the podcast here. :)

summary:
Michael Sheen joins David this week to talk Good Omens, becoming Tony Blair, and how he returned home to Port Talbot.
Listen now...
body:
Michael Sheen joins David this week to talk Good Omens, becoming Tony Blair, and how he returned home to Port Talbot.

Listen now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or wherever you get your podcasts from:

https://podcasts.apple.com/podcast/michael-sheen

summary: Michael Sheen | David Tennant Does a Podcast With… on acast
title: Michael Sheen | David Tennant Does a Podcast With… on acast
excerpt: The Good Omens star talks about becoming Brian Clough, Tony Blair and most recently Aziraphale, how early criticism helped shape his career and how he found his way home to Port Talbot.If you’re easily offended, there are some swears. A Somethin’ Else and No Mystery production.

blog.name: sunniebelle
blog.title: SunnieBelle
blog.description:
I'm a Texas-born-and-raised southern gal.
Just recently I was introduce to the incredible world of Doctor Who and immediately fell in love with it! I am a hard-core shipper of the Doctor and Rose Tyler, and especially of the 9th, 10th and/or Tentoo Doctor and Rose.
I'm also a huge fan of Scott Westerfeld's "Leviathan" trilogy! (btw: If you haven't read this series, I highly recommend them to people of any age. They are amazing!)
I love any shade of purple, all things horses and adore the sound of the violins and cellos together.  I'm an amateur writer and love to use my over-active imagination. I'm also an amateur artist, mostly pencil drawings. Go check out my artwork and original stories, if you would like to, on www.deviantart.com/sunniebelle You can also find me on fanfiction.net, TSP, and A03 where most of my DW and Leviathan fics are. :)
